questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Solar (UMS) has business and person accounts in its Salesforce org. UMS has partner portals created for its Silver partners, DreamHouse Realty (DR) and Cloud Kicks (CK).
UMS’s Implementation team is creating users for its partners. DR and CK users do not require access to opportunities, leads, and campaigns.
What are the two considerations for creating partner users and granting access? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
The only access required is to opportunities, leads, and campaigns. So a partner community license is not needed making D incorrect. Also, person accounts can not be used to make partner users. The correct answer seems to be B and C.

B & C are the right options.
Person accounts can be enabled as users for customer Experience Cloud sites and portals.
Person accounts can't be enabled as users for partner Experience Cloud sites and portals because partners represent companies,
not individuals. Similarly, person accounts can’t be used with Lightning External Apps Plus licenses.
https://blog.bessereau.eu/assets/pdfs/salesforce_B2C_implementation_guide.pdf
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.users_license_types_communities.htm&type=5

Answer should be BD? Customer community plus licenses cannot be used with B2B accounts (partner accounts)
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.users_license_types_communities.htm&type=5
BC, CD doesnt make any sense to me

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Solar (UMS) works with local installation companies. The installers need to collaborate with their co-workers as well as with UMS staff.

Which user visibility setting needs to be enabled at a minimum?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It talks about UMS internal staff as well. and Site User Visibility doesn't give that option.
Portal User Visibility gives the option to collaborate with internal users as well.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.
Local installation companies ( could be 2, 3, 5... who are not related to each other) need visibility to UMS staff.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=release-notes.rn_networks_visibility_default.htm&release=222&type=5

Selected Answer: D
Portal User Visibility is minimum to enable, for local installation companies to collaborate with UMS employees

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer. "To enable the installers to collaborate with their co-workers and UMS staff, UMS needs to enable Portal User Visibility. This is a user visibility setting that allows portal users to see other portal users who have the same role or a role below them in the role hierarchy. This also allows portal users to see internal users who are above them in the role hierarchy. Portal User Visibility can be enabled in the Sharing Settings page in Setup"
